To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm <FI>or<Fi> Song. God be merciful unto us, and bless us; <FI>and<Fi> cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.<RF>upon: Heb. with<Rf>
That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.
Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.
O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.<RF>govern: Heb. lead<Rf>
Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.
<FI>Then<Fi> shall the earth yield her increase; <FI>and<Fi> God, <FI>even<Fi> our own God, shall bless us.
God shall bless us; and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.<CM>
